53da1882-1ae2-45a2-8c10-6db7c099c4fc.description: This course taught students contemporary workplace evaluation and assessment methods. Evaluation and assessments are presented as continuous improvement exercises involving employees and/or outside reviewers, vendors, funders, clients and the general public. Students are trained in setting goals, tracking performance, collecting data, making midcourse corrections and analyzing program impact.
53da1882-1ae2-45a2-8c10-6db7c099c4fc.name: Assessment in the Workplace - LDR 220

badge_template_activities.title: The workplace evaluation course contributes to the need for workplace leaders to use data to assess and improve responsibilities under their supervision and leadership. It also helps leaders understand how and why their outcomes would be evaluated for effectiveness.
Develop a research question to measure an organizational outcome.
Assess, synthesize and integrate peer-reviewed literature and develop logical conclusions based on the principles of scientific inquiry.
Conduct needs assessment data collection. For example, may be completed through the use of surveys, performance interviews, compilation of program outcomes, cost analysis and/or focus groups.
Present evaluation data in a credible, objective, and persuasive manner in both written and oral formats.
Use data results to plan, develop, and present an effective evaluation of a workplace initiative or workplace intervention.
The badge recipient earned a C or higher in the course to be awarded this credential.

719d715b-7564-43ee-a6c1-b8c9b3ab21e3.description: Design thinking is for everyone. It is a systematic approach to innovation and creative problem-solving that can be used in many disciplines. This design thinking training integrates the method and process of design thinking to solve a local problem. This training is for all majors from all disciplines. Badge earners learn the design thinking process and work in collaborative teams to address real issues on our campus and in our community.
719d715b-7564-43ee-a6c1-b8c9b3ab21e3.name: Introduction to Design Thinking

badge_template_activities.title: Badger earner participated in a 90-minute interactive workshop.
Students applied design thinking principles and created a solution prototype.

f2768db0-776a-4879-8418-2e3d84349f26.description: Students explored many forms of workplace communication both verbal and nonverbal. Students learned about and practiced effective strategies in both oral and written communication. In addition, students learned the art of sharing knowledge and ideas in a way that transmits a sense of purpose and enthusiasm to others.
f2768db0-776a-4879-8418-2e3d84349f26.name: Effective Communication in the Workplace - LDR 100

badge_template_activities.title: Bringing together theory and practice of effective workplace communication through structured exercises that require self-reflection and critical thinking; Utilize experiential learning to help students practice and improve practical skills involved in everything from face-to-face conversations to giving a presentation at a professional meeting; Enhance students’ confidence in a variety of verbal and nonverbal communication; Examination of one’s own communication style.
Discuss the importance of effective communication in professional settings
Produce professionally formatted emails, memos, letters, agendas, action plans, and technical reports
Analyze workplace communication using theory-driven models of effective communication
Apply effective listening techniques to improve workplace communication
Write and deliver employee evaluations
Apply effective negotiation strategies
Facilitate the use of conflict resolution strategies
Deliver informative and engaging presentations
Communicate workplace expectations
Assess one’s own communication style
Analyze and adapt to individual differences in interpersonal communication styles
The badge recipient earned a C or higher in the course to be awarded this credential.

b135bac0-87be-42fc-88a1-af87dc7024a6.description: This course introduced students to the fundamental principles of leadership, ethics, and critical thinking that should establish the foundation of their academic, professional, and personal development. The course studies ethics in the workplace and the role of organizational leaders in fostering ethical behavior, including hiring, supervision, termination, and compliance.
b135bac0-87be-42fc-88a1-af87dc7024a6.name: Ethical Leadership in the Workplace - LDR 200

badge_template_activities.title: The course is situated around the ethical dimensions of leadership, where you will learn to recognize, apply, and integrate ethical reasoning practices in various contexts, including the role of hiring and supervising others. This course is designed to help you better understand the ways in which you are already making ethical decisions and to promote reflection and dialogue in order to help you think about ethical leadership in even deeper, more complex ways.
Apply critical thinking skills in resolving ethical issues
Describe and analyze ethical issues and dilemmas
Demonstrate awareness of one’s own values and investigate the interrelationships and tensions that occur between personal, professional, and societal values.
Describe best practices for hiring, supervising, and terminating employees in a legal and ethical manner
Demonstrate knowledge of employment law, workplace safety, and personal liability for supervisors
Be able to use multiple leadership concepts to understand leadership situations and enhance your effectiveness in the leadership process.
Enhance your ability to participate in and to lead a small group with an interdependent task.
Enhance your ability to think critically, to analyze complex and diverse concepts, and to use your reasoning, judgment and imagination to create new possibilities in leadership situations.
The badge recipient earned a C or higher in the course to be awarded this credential.

e852fa19-87d6-41a8-afb9-790dcd4ba317.description: This course is designed to help students explore foundational information related to diversity and multiculturalism. Students will learn the importance of understanding cultural and demographic diversity in relation to effective workplace leadership. Contemporary issues of social diversity in workforce recruitment, management, training and development will be focal points.
e852fa19-87d6-41a8-afb9-790dcd4ba317.name: Leadership in Diverse Workplaces - LDR 300

badge_template_activities.title: Improved students understanding of diversity in the workplace by exploring cultural diversity and contemporary diversity issues; Shifting students emphasis from diversity-related problems to diversity-related opportunities by teaching how to create an environment that capitalizes on the creativity and richness that increased diversity offers; Increase students’ awareness of and desire to promote social justice and inclusion in the workplace.
Recognize and apply critical thinking skills to a variety of individual, societal, and organizational dynamics related to diversity and inclusion in the workplace
Explain how diversity impacts leadership in the workplace - Analyze complex individual/societal/organizational workforce issues associated with human diversity and inclusion
Deconstruct the ways in which aspects of human difference shapes a person’s experience of and perspectives in the workplace
Recognize and propose solutions to organizational problems that can inhibit the full participation of many diverse employees
Identify and apply various strategies for building bridges between diverse groups to improve workforce relationships
Assess their personal views of diversity
Develop a personal awareness plan of action
Demonstrate leadership skills that reflect an appreciation for human difference and that support social justice and inclusion
Identify and summarize the strategies needed to improve the workplace climate that capitalizes on the full contribution of all workplace members
The badge recipient earned a C or higher in the course to be awarded this credential.

17b0064b-8aa1-4faf-95bf-de46142e01c1.description: The primary emphasis in this course is the introduction of basic systems thinking fundamentals, i.e. defining a systems perspective about any situation or problem, solving problems with that perspective, describing and modeling a problem, and designing and improving upon system solutions. Systems thinking is a discipline of seeing the whole, recognizing patterns and interrelationships, and learning how to innovate more effective, efficient and creative system solutions.
17b0064b-8aa1-4faf-95bf-de46142e01c1.name: Systems Thinking in Workplace Leadership - LDR 400

badge_template_activities.title: This is an introductory course in “systems thinking,” a leadership model that recognizes that people, structures, and processes interact within organizational systems to foster organizational health. The purpose of this course is to introduce the students to a new way of thinking and its applications. This course proposes a profound transformation in our traditional way of thinking.  This course aims at stimulating the integration of logical (Cartesian) thinking with systems thinking.

Identify and describe how individuals and small or large groups interact within organizations, as well as the nature of complex systems (which include human beings and their organizations) and how they function in concert
Provide an overview of the history of and perspectives on systems thinking
Identify and describe how patterns drive daily and operational behavior and how they prevent the natural evolution of the systems.
Identify and describe the role of power and privilege in an organization’s functioning
Diagram patterns of behavior within systems using causal loop diagramming to create shared vision
Articulate the value of learning within an industry, profession, and organization
Use systems thinking to enhance team development and performance
Identify and describe why short-term approaches and solutions are conducive to unsustainable practices and harming habits.
Conceptualize future possibilities and actions from different perspectives using scenario planning
The badge recipient earned a C or higher in the course to be awarded this credential.

c33ac69c-7501-42b5-a46c-802f7f141ee8.description: NMU Online Teaching Fellows is a professional development initiative sponsored by the Office of Extended Learning and Community Engagement and facilitated by the Center for Teaching and Learning. The goal of the initiative is to develop faculty expertise in the design, development, and delivery of online courses in order to build and enhance online programs.
c33ac69c-7501-42b5-a46c-802f7f141ee8.name: Online Teaching Fellows - Program 1

alignments.name: Quality Matters
alignments.description: Quality Matters is the global organization leading quality assurance in online and innovative digital teaching and learning environments.

badge_template_activities.title: Program 1 will provide participants with strong foundations in the design, development, and teaching of online courses. Upon completion of Program 1, participants will be able to:
Design an online course that meets Quality Matters standards.
Plan research-informed strategies for managing an online course.
Select strategies for engaging students in an online course.
Create various types of online content, activities, and assessments.
Apply self-assessment tools for formative evaluation of online teaching.
Outline NMU’s plans to ensure quality in its online offerings.

skills.name: Best Practices In Online Course Design

44359967-d5ef-45c8-b62f-b57bdae2cfe8.description: Earners of the Cannabis Agriculture and Horticulture badge have developed the entry-level skills needed for the complex process of cannabis production, management and cultivation. Students are competent in plant care and yield maximization.
44359967-d5ef-45c8-b62f-b57bdae2cfe8.name: Cannabis Agriculture and Horticulture

badge_template_activities.title: Complete weekly instructor-led assignments.
Acquire knowledge of accurate information needed to effectively engage in cannabis production, management and cultivation.
Complete a final portfolio of resources for responsibly building and managing a grow site.

5036e057-3205-4055-8927-4ac1ed64e878.description: This 8-week online program addresses effective counseling tools and techniques for all kinds of losses (ex. death, divorce, work). Participants will learn the principles and many practical tools and techniques to enhance their professional and personal life related to grief. The program is very interactive, focusing on practical tools applicable to adults, children and families. Participants will have the opportunity to interact on Zoom, forums and work on a project under instructor guidance.
5036e057-3205-4055-8927-4ac1ed64e878.name: Grief Support Specialist

badge_template_activities.title: Participants can earn Social Work Continuing Education Hours or Teacher Continuing Education Clock Hours.

9c7f0a46-ba1b-44c5-bf4b-62f0e36a1ec2.description: NMU Online Teaching Fellows is a professional development initiative sponsored by the Office of Extended Learning and Community Engagement and facilitated by the Center for Teaching and Learning. The goal of the initiative is to develop faculty expertise in the design, development, and delivery of online courses in order to build and enhance online programs.
9c7f0a46-ba1b-44c5-bf4b-62f0e36a1ec2.name: Online Teaching Fellows - Program 2

alignments.name: Quality Matters
alignments.description: Quality Matters is the global organization leading quality assurance in online and innovative digital teaching and learning environments. Quality Matters is the global organization leading quality assurance in online and innovative digital teaching and learning environments.

badge_template_activities.title: Program 2 provides participants with experience designing and developing a full online course, as well as hands-on experience reviewing peers’ online courses.
Design and develop a complete online course that meets Quality Matters standards.
Participate in a complete internal Quality Matters course review.
Provide peer feedback on teaching practices in an online course.
Present their online courses as examples to their academic departments.

e2fd75b0-0893-4eb2-9198-575fa4eb16c9.description: Earners of the Business of Cannabis badge have developed the entry-level skills needed to effectively understand the challenges and opportunities presented by the cannabis business. Students will have a clear understanding of the cannabis industry, how it got there and where it is going. Students are competent in skills required throughout the entire process from seed to sale.
e2fd75b0-0893-4eb2-9198-575fa4eb16c9.name: The Business of Cannabis

badge_template_activities.title: Complete weekly instructor-led assignments.
Acquire knowledge of specialists that is key in the cannabis industry.
Complete a business portfolio that includes project management materials, risk analysis, accounting and operations reports, and a case study analysis.

3e5b398d-4fe5-4134-a75f-f05c9b27ee57.description: The courses in the program help students develop the skills that employers value in project leaders, team leaders and managers. The certificate emphasizes the use of critical thinking, ethical decision-making, goal-oriented communication, observational and quantitative data in decision-making and ways in which diversity can be leveraged for improved workplace climate and productivity.
3e5b398d-4fe5-4134-a75f-f05c9b27ee57.name: Applied Workplace Leadership Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully completed Effective Communication in the Workplace - LDR 100
Successfully completed Ethical Leadership in the Workplace - LDR 200
Successfully completed Assessment in the Workplace - LDR 220
Successfully completed Leadership in Diverse Workplaces - LDR 300

d1163eae-ba65-4425-966c-48c9f74f5058.description: Earners of the Cannabis of Healthcare and Medicine badge have developed the entry-level skills needed to acquire the knowledge helpful for healthcare professionals seeking a career in cannabis medicine, or looking to add cannabis expertise to their existing practice. Students are competent in the medical properties of cannabis.
d1163eae-ba65-4425-966c-48c9f74f5058.name: Cannabis Healthcare and Medicine

badge_template_activities.title: Complete weekly instructor-led assignments.
Acquire knowledge of specialists that is key in the cannabis healthcare industry.
Complete a healthcare portfolio that includes project management materials, risk analysis, accounting and operations reports, and a case study analysis.

skills.name: Ethics & Law For Cannabis Healthcare Practitioners
Human Physiology & The Metabolic Pathways For Cannabis

66387406-60fd-4ca7-8d8c-ae2db9d0b473.description: This badge is awarded to students who participated in NMU's 2021 Three Minute Thesis Competition.
66387406-60fd-4ca7-8d8c-ae2db9d0b473.name: NMU Three Minute Thesis 2021

badge_template_activities.title: Each researcher presents their research in three minutes with one static slide to aid in the presentation. Three Minute Thesis was developed by The University of Queensland (UQ) and has become a worldwide academic competition. "3MT cultivates students’ academic, presentation, and research communication skills. The competition supports their capacity to effectively explain their research in three minutes, in a language appropriate to a non-specialist audience."

c3ff24b4-fbf1-4b89-af62-e8f49b03fb8a.description: NMU McNair Scholars participate in a timed research presentation competition where the aim is to concisely present their research in a way that is accessible to a general audience.
c3ff24b4-fbf1-4b89-af62-e8f49b03fb8a.name: McNair Research Competition Participation 2021

badge_template_activities.title: Participated in 2021 Research Competition by presenting their original research to an audience and judges in 3 minutes.

21532cc1-8acb-47b0-bb05-4eb6ff7728a1.description: Earners of the Cannabis Law and Policy badge have developed the entry-level skills needed to participate in the ever-changing legal landscape surrounding the cannabis industry. Students are competent in the world of cannabis regulation, compliance and public policy.
21532cc1-8acb-47b0-bb05-4eb6ff7728a1.name: Cannabis Law and Policy

badge_template_activities.title: Complete weekly instructor-led assignments.
Acquire knowledge to specialize in agriculture, entrepreneurial, or healthcare law and policy and to meaningfully engage with the legal landscape around cannabis.
Complete a legal portfolio that includes project management materials, risk analysis, accounting and operations reports, and a case study analysis.

8fcdaf99-1f20-4bbe-abaa-924a1540253a.description: Wilderness Medicine Training Center International's Wilderness First Responder Course exceeds the minimum WFR Scope of Practice guidelines established by the Wilderness Medicine Education Collaborative. When you have successfully completed the course, you will be able to successfully demonstrate the skills presented during your course. You will also receive a WMTC Epinephrine certification card confirming that you have been taught how to treat anaphylaxis with injectable epinephrine..
8fcdaf99-1f20-4bbe-abaa-924a1540253a.name: Standard Wilderness First Responder

badge_template_activities.title: 80 Hours. Days 1-8 (8-9 hours), Day 9 (8 hours)
